intro: Hieracium pantepsilon, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically has basal leaves that are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. It is native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa, and has been introduced to other regions. Hieracium pantepsilon is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, where it spreads through rhizomes and seeds.
